description: From Middle English unsemli, probably a partial calque of Old Norse úsǽmiligr (“unseemly”); equivalent to un- +‎ seemly. Cognate with Icelandic ósæmileg (“offensive”), Norwegian usømmelig (“unseemly”), Danish usømmeligt (“unseemly”).

entries.meaning: Inconsistent with established standards of good form or taste.
examples: He was drunk and made some very unseemly comments.

adverbs.description: unseemly (comparative more unseemly, superlative most unseemly)
